name: Monster Babe
text: Nice security. Very clean and beautiful parking lot with gorgeous plants and flowers everywhere.

name: Ericka Lewis
text: It was a great place to work

name: Rinda Hopkins
text: Unfortunately this call center is closing.

name: Shaun Capps
text: Very good experience. I met some nice people here today.

name: Sara Beth Blair
text:
I had to wait three days on 811 before underground
Leak could be repaired.  No excuse to be OUT
Of WATER  3 days due to wait. They need more crew technicians on the job. I see now why people go ahead and dig instead of long wait!

resp.text:
I understand your frustration, however understand we are ONLY the centralized notification center that receives the request for the lines to be marked and then relays it pretty much immediately to the utility companies. We do not field or employ crew technicians to identify the lines, that would be on the utilities themselves, and/or a contract locating company they have hired to come out and actually mark the lines.

Alabama state law does require that the utilities be allowed two working days notice for them to have time to respond to the request, BUT in your case, if you were out of water, whomever notified Alabama 811, should have submitted an emergency locate request, which would have escalated your timeline to get the lines marked.    If you ever run across issues such as this again, please feel free to contact me, and I will be happy to assist.

Additionally if you would like to call or email me your address, we keep records of all request for a good while, so i can get answers as to whether or not the excavator called it in as an emergency, etc. and provide you some more details.

I do know this is several months past due on a response, but we are going to try and keep a better eye on any requests and review.

McKay Lyvers
Damage Prevention Manager
Alabama 811
205-731-3207
mlyvers@al811.com

name: Georgeanne Jones
text: I work there at the call center. Love all the folks I work with. Lisa & Tina are awesome supervisors. I can't leave out Shonnie, Lee, Kayla & Eric, they're all pretty cool to work for.
